main_text.sentence: Metaphase spreads were prepared for immunofluorescence using previously described protocols [29].
Cells were processed for immunoflourescence staining as described earlier [27].
Immunofluorescence of tubulin and reconstruction of microtubules images were carried out as described previously [19].
Sera of all patients and controls were titrated for antibodies directed against EBV antigens by indirect immunofluorescence [27].
The immunofluorescence staining protocol resulted in a significant decrease of inherent intestinal granular autofluorescence previously assigned to secondary lysosomes [32].
For immunofluorescence, trypanosomes were spread onto poly-L-lysine-coated slides, fixed in cold methanol and processed as described [75].
Historically and indeed currently immunofluorescence [2] and virus culture [3,4] are the main methods used to diagnose acute respiratory virus infections.
Earlier immunofluorescence studies indicated that maternal and zygotic MVP is located in the cytoplasm, whereas adult MVP is predominantly nuclear [16].
